tier_1_determinative.key_facts: The appellant, John @ Vivek Ramesh Jadhav, was convicted for offences under section 10 of the Protection of Children from Sexual Offences Act, 2012, and section 506 of IPC. The incident involved the appellant calling an 8-year-old girl into his room, making inappropriate advances, and threatening her.

tier_2_material.material_facts: The appellant was sentenced to five years of rigorous imprisonment and fined Rs. 1000 for the offence under section 10 of the POCSO Act. For the offence under section 506 of IPC, he was sentenced to one year of rigorous imprisonment and fined Rs. 1000. The prosecution's case was based on the testimony of the victim and her mother, with no medical evidence presented.

tier_4_procedural.case_title: John @ Vivek Ramesh Jadhav vs. The State of Maharashtra
tier_4_procedural.court_name: High Court of Judicature at Bombay
tier_4_procedural.sections_invoked: Section 10 of the POCSO Act, Section 506 of IPC
tier_4_procedural.acts_and_sections: Protection of Children from Sexual Offences Act, 2012; Indian Penal Code

residual_details.additional_facts: The appellant was the landlord of the victim's family, who were tenants in his chawl. There were strained relations due to arrears of rent and a demand to vacate the premises, which was suggested as a possible motive for false allegations.
